I don't know if you guys are aware but Scotland play the USA at football(or soccer) at the weekend.
 
 I am going to the game in my kilt to have a good time and I am hopping that Scotland put in a good performance against the US. 
 
 I don't know much about the US International Soccer team so what is your opinion on how good they are ? Also are any of you guys going to watch the game ? and How popular is Soccer in the US ?
 
 I will also use this thread to post a 'post match' review of the game that will only happen if I don't get too drunk and forget the whole game. :)

 I didn't know the US HAD a soccer team. We stop playing it here just after grade school. I remember vaugly that 20 years ago soccer made a slight comeback, but I was unaware there were ANY professional soccer teams operating int he US, so I would imagine you guys have a good shot.
Big_Bear_Scot

I didn't know the US HAD a soccer team. We stop playing it here just after grade school. I remember vaugly that 20 years ago soccer made a slight comeback, but I was unaware there were ANY professional soccer teams operating int he US, so I would imagine you guys have a good shot.

 
 You guys have a professional league called the Major League Soccer I think it was setup up after the 1994 World Cup that was held in the States. Also I think your National team is above us in the FIFA World rankings. 
 
 You guys are 6th in the World above England and France. Which is rather good IMHO considering you are not a traditional Soccer Nation. Whereas lowly Scotland are 85th in the World just behind Canada ! emoticon_cry
 
 If we take the World Rankings into account then it would seem Scotland are the underdogs as Scotland are whopping 79 places behind the US.
Heads_On_Pikes

Soccer is huge where I live in the midwest U.S. It has grown in popularity tremendously in the past twenty years. We now have 54 dedicated soccer fields on park district property alone. I can witness as to the popularity here because the industrial park I work in also hosts the first of the large area soccer complexes. Many a time I have battled incoming weekend tournament traffic leaving work on summertime fridays. Is it to much to ask for mini-van people to get the hell out of my way so I can get myself to a cold beer??? I think not.
 
 Soccer is also has been a high school sport in the state of Illinois as well for a good many years.
 
 Daewoo is right in that back in our days of our youth soccer was nearly non-existant in the U.S. We learned to play it in school gym class for a week or so and that was the end of it. Dribbling the soccer ball around some orange cones on a blacktop playground is the way I remember the instruction -- NOT a hell-of-a lotta fun...unless one purposly knocks down every friggin' cone to get a laugh from one's fellow students. :p 
 
 Anyhoo, good luck to the team from Scotland. 
 
 Get drunk? Hey, what the hell, do you mean don't they cut off beer sales halfway through the sporting events like they do in the U.S.? :( emoticon_xhoho
Big_Bear_Scot

Anyhoo, good luck to the team from Scotland. 
 
 Get drunk? Hey, what the hell, do you mean don't they cut off beer sales halfway through the sporting events like they do in the U.S.? :( emoticon_xhoho

 
 They don't see any beer inside the Stadium during the game, the trick is to get just the right amount of drunk before the game so that you will still be able to watch the game. Then when the drink starts to wear off, usually by Full Time then you get to the closest Pub and that is where the Real fun Starts :)
 
 It will be interesting day I assure you.
 
 Glad to hear that the beautiful game has some admirers among our American Brethren.

 At one point, Kansas City had two soccer teams. The Attack and The Wizards (or The Wiz, I'm not sure, it's been a while.) I have no idea if we have either anymore. The only thing KC has in the realm of sports right now are the Royals (Baseball) the Chiefs (American football) and then the various local high school and little league sports and the like. Oh, we also have the T-Bones (Minor League Baseball) and a race car track (for the people who do call that a sport.) But soccer is played here in the states but it's not as big of a deal as Baseball or Football (depending on who you ask.)
 
Whereas lowly Scotland are 85th in the World just behind Canada !
What I said above about Football and Baseball, that goes for hockey in Canada. (I mean I would assume that is why they made such a big deal about the hockey strike.) Probably the people over here who really care for professional soccer are the players, the families, and the real die-hard fans of the game.

Many a time I have battled incoming weekend tournament traffic leaving work on summertime fridays. Is it to much to ask for mini-van people to get the hell out of my way so I can get myself to a cold beer??? I think not.
